intro: Torminaria latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf torminaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical heads, often displaying shades of yellow to brown. Torminaria latifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
